definition: an ugly wife is a treasure at home (idiom)
pinyin: chou3 qi1 jin4 di4 jia1 zhong1 bao3

definition: clown/2nd earthly branch: 1-3 a.m., 12th solar month (6th January to 3rd February), year of the Ox/ancient Chinese compass point: 30°
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
if you marry a chicken follow the chicken, if you marry a dog follow the dog (idiom)
pinyin: jia4 ji1 sui2 ji1 , jia4 gou3 sui2 gou3

definition: If you marry a chicken, follow the chicken (idiom); A woman should follow whatever her husband orders./We must learn to accept the people around us.

lit. the dog that bites does not show its fangs (idiom)/fig. You can't tell the really dangerous enemy from his external appearance.

definition: as they say, .../as the saying goes, ...
